comments.html:
Couldn't agree more.
I reckon "Layer-3 and DNS are theoretically sufficient" includes client side session management, as this should be an essential part of modern software architecture. Approaches (global) load balancers, BGP anycast, (round robin/smart) DNS, etc. introduce yet another set of complicated kludges. A true active/active, stateless, scalable design should be a product of a combined infrastructure and software development effort. Instead of all the little birdies crapping on each other and blaming each other :)
comments.name: Albert Siersema
